shortFormVideos.longDescription: This educational video provides a foundational understanding of how streaming technology functions on the Roku platform, detailing content delivery from CDNs to Roku devices via content feeds.
shortFormVideos.shortDescription: Learn how streaming works on the Roku platform.
shortFormVideos.title: Streaming overview

shortFormVideos.longDescription: Explore the educational opportunities for developers on the Roku platform. This video highlights that developing for Roku is free and easy, covering the cost-free enrollment, channel development, and publishing process to the Roku Channel Store. It also introduces SceneGraph (Roku's UI XML framework) and BrightScript (Roku's scripting language).
shortFormVideos.shortDescription: Discover the educational opportunities for developing on the Roku platform.
shortFormVideos.title: Roku Development Overview

shortFormVideos.longDescription: This educational video provides a step-by-step guide on how to enable Developer Mode on a Roku device, an essential process for those looking to begin Roku development.
shortFormVideos.shortDescription: Learn to enable Developer Mode on a Roku device.
shortFormVideos.title: Enabling Developer Mode

shortFormVideos.longDescription: This educational video demonstrates the 'Direct to Play' and 'Enhanced Voice Control' features, showcasing how users can efficiently interact with Roku devices using voice commands.
shortFormVideos.title: Voice Features

series.title: Roku Tips & Tricks
series.shortDescription: This educational series offers valuable tips and tricks for optimizing your Roku experience and maximizing its features.

episodes.title: How to listen to music
episodes.shortDescription: Learn how to stream music on your Roku device.
episodes.longDescription: This educational video teaches you how to effectively stream music on your Roku device, enhancing your audio experience.

episodes.title: Best speaker placement
episodes.shortDescription: Discover optimal placement for your Roku audio devices.
episodes.longDescription: This educational video helps you find the best placement for your Roku audio devices to enhance sound quality and optimize your listening experience.

episodes.title: Guest Mode
episodes.shortDescription: Learn to let guests stream with their own accounts.
episodes.longDescription: This educational video teaches you how to enable and utilize Guest Mode, allowing visitors to stream content using their own accounts without affecting your personal settings.

episodes.title: Private Listening
episodes.shortDescription: Understand the benefits of Private Listening.
episodes.longDescription: This educational video helps you understand the benefits and functionality of Roku's Private Listening feature for an individualized audio experience.

series.title: SceneGraph Developers: Build a Channel
series.shortDescription: This comprehensive course teaches novice Roku developers how to develop a channel from the ground up with the Roku SDK, covering each step to build a basic, high-performance channel that passes certification. It's ideal for new developers.

episodes.title: Introduction to the course
episodes.shortDescription: Watch the introduction to the 'SceneGraph: Build a Channel' development course.
episodes.longDescription: This educational video serves as an introduction to the 'SceneGraph: Build a Channel' development course, outlining the course syllabus and what to expect.

episodes.title: Development setup
episodes.shortDescription: Learn the initial steps for Roku platform development.
episodes.longDescription: This educational lesson explains the first steps to start developing for the Roku platform, including creating required user and developer accounts, enabling your test Roku device for development, and sideloading Roku's 'Hello World' channel to view its output in the debug console.

episodes.title: Core concepts
episodes.shortDescription: Review key concepts for developing on the Roku platform.
episodes.longDescription: This educational lesson reviews key concepts for developing on the Roku platform, explaining basic design principles, providing an overview of Roku's development platform, and reviewing the contents and structure of Roku channels. You'll learn about SceneGraph and BrightScript, different types of components, and more, preparing you to work on your first Roku channel.

episodes.title: Creating the content feed
episodes.shortDescription: Understand how the content feed loads and organizes content.
episodes.longDescription: This educational lesson explains how the content feed is used to load and organize content in the channel. It details how the ContentNode maps metadata in your content feed to components in your channel UI and provides tips for creating your own feed.

episodes.title: Creating a Grid Screen
episodes.shortDescription: Learn to build a grid screen that displays rows of content.
episodes.longDescription: This educational lesson describes how to create a basic channel that retrieves videos from a content feed and displays them in a grid. It explains how to create SceneGraph components, set their attributes, create their interfaces, and use BrightScript to parse and add metadata to content nodes.

episodes.title: Adding the Video Player
episodes.shortDescription: Add a video player to launch content for playback.
episodes.longDescription: This educational lesson teaches you how to add the SceneGraph Video node to your channel and link it to content in other components. It explains how to open the video screen when content is selected and close it when playback finishes or the back button is pressed.

episodes.title: Debugging channels
episodes.shortDescription: Learn to debug Roku channels using the debug console.
episodes.longDescription: This educational lesson teaches you how to access the debug console via Telnet and the Roku Eclipse Plug-in, and how to use different debug ports. It explains how to view crash logs, stack traces, and channel performance metrics, and how to use the interactive debugger for checking variable values, calling functions, and stepping through your application.

episodes.title: Creating a Details Screen
episodes.shortDescription: Build a details screen to display content information.
episodes.longDescription: This educational lesson guides you in building a details screen that provides more information about content selected in the GridScreen, including release date, rating, genre, cast, and detailed description. It explains how to build a screen using more complex SceneGraph components, create a Play button, populate the screen with metadata, and manage focus.

episodes.title: Creating an Episodes Screen
episodes.shortDescription: Learn to build an episodes screen to organize TV series.
episodes.longDescription: This educational lesson teaches you how to build an episodes screen that organizes television series into seasons and episodes. You'll learn to use new components like MarkupList and layer components for complex UIs, as well as how to parse content feeds to populate an episode screen with sequential seasons and their respective episodes.

episodes.title: Displaying Video Ads
episodes.shortDescription: Learn to monetize content through video ads.
episodes.longDescription: This educational lesson explains how to monetize content on the Roku platform through video ads. It covers implementing the Roku Advertising Framework (RAF) for seamless ad insertion, detailing various client and server-side ad solutions, and how to get started with RAF to display video ads in your channel.

episodes.title: Offering Subscriptions
episodes.shortDescription: Monetize your channel by offering subscriptions via Roku Pay.
episodes.longDescription: This educational lesson explains how to monetize content on your channel by offering subscriptions directly on-device through Roku Pay. It covers getting started with Roku Pay, creating channels, in-channel products, and test users, and details the Roku Pay workflow from checking entitlements to completing purchases and granting content access. It also explains how to integrate Roku Web Service RESTful APIs into your backend system for validation, refunds, and cancellations.

episodes.title: Deep Linking (part 1)
episodes.shortDescription: Implement deep linking to get users to content quickly.
episodes.longDescription: This educational lesson explains how to implement deep linking to get users to content as fast as possible. You'll learn to program your channel application to accept and process deep links upon launch and while running, configure playback experiences for content types, create bookmarks for user playback position, and create smart bookmarks for TV series.

episodes.title: Deep Linking (part 2)
episodes.shortDescription: Further implement deep linking for rapid content access.
episodes.longDescription: This educational lesson continues the discussion on implementing deep linking to get users to content as fast as possible. You'll learn to program your channel application to accept and process deep links upon launch and while running, configure playback experiences for content types, and create bookmarks to store user playback position in the device registry or backend system.

episodes.title: Certification Testing
episodes.shortDescription: Prepare your channel for publication to the Roku channel store.
episodes.longDescription: This educational lesson explains how to prepare your channel to be published to the Roku channel store. It teaches you how to test your channel's design and performance and verify that it meets all of Roku's certification criteria using Roku's test automation software and automated testing tools. It also provides a quick demo of Roku's Static Analysis tool, which detects certification-related issues with your channel's code.

movies.longDescription: This educational video demonstrates the Roku Remote Debugger and illustrates how the BrightScript network debug protocol can be used in an integration with an IDE such as Visual Studio Code.
movies.shortDescription: Educational demonstration of the Roku Remote Debugger.
movies.title: BrightScript debug protocol

movies.longDescription: This educational video demonstrates the Roku automated channel testing software, providing a brief overview of the technology stack and showing how both the Roku WebDriver and Robot Framework Library can be used for state-driven channel UI automation testing.
movies.shortDescription: Educational demo of Roku automated channel testing.
movies.title: Automated channel testing

movies.longDescription: This educational video demonstrates how a developer can use the Developer Dashboard's user access management feature to give team members the authority to take administrative actions appropriate for their respective organizational roles.
movies.shortDescription: Educational demo on managing user access.
movies.title: Managing user access
